ilda

Class ilda

  • java.lang.Object
    • ilda.Ilda

  • public class ilda
extends java.lang.Object
    This package allows you to render ilda files straight from Processing!

      • getStatus

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getStatus()
        Any error, quirk, remark, success and such is stored within the class. Use this method to retrieve it for eg a console-like text box. This is for testing purposes and will get eliminated when stuff gets more mature.
        Returns:
        The status

      • readFile

        public java.util.ArrayList<IldaFrame> readFile(java.lang.String location)
        Parse an ilda file from disk
        Parameters:
        location - path to the ilda file
        Returns:
        list of all loaded frames

      • readPicFile

        public IldaFrame readPicFile(java.lang.String location)

      • writeFile

        public static void writeFile(java.util.ArrayList<IldaFrame> frames,
                             java.lang.String location)
        You should call fixHeaders() first before using this method! Writes a valid ilda file to a certain location in format 4 (3D, RGB). Checks if the specified location has a valid .ild extension. You should call fixHeaders() first before using this method! Otherwise the ilda file will not be valid. This does not happen automatically for maximum flexibility (but is maybe a bad idea)
        Parameters:
        location - The path to where the ilda file should be exported
        frames - All frames that should be included in the ilda file

      • writeFile

        public static void writeFile(java.util.ArrayList<IldaFrame> frames,
                             java.lang.String location,
                             int ildaVersion)
        You should call fixHeaders() first before using this method! Writes a valid ilda file to a certain location with specified format. Checks if the specified location has a valid .ild extension. You should call fixHeaders() first before using this method! Otherwise the ilda file will not be valid. This does not happen automatically for maximum flexibility (but is maybe a bad idea)
        Parameters:
        location - The path to where the ilda file should be exported
        frames - All frames that should be included in the ilda file
        ildaVersion - ilda format: 0 = 3D, palette; 1 = 2D, palette; (2 = palette header); (3 = deprecated); 4 = 3D, RGB; 5 = 2D, RGB

      • writeFile

        public static void writeFile(java.lang.String location,
                             java.util.ArrayList<IldaFrame> frames,
                             IldaPalette palette,
                             int ildaVersion)
        You should call fixHeaders() first before using this method! Writes a valid ilda file to a certain location with specified format including a palette. Checks if the specified location has a valid .ild extension. You should call fixHeaders() first before using this method! Otherwise the ilda file will not be valid. This does not happen automatically for maximum flexibility (but is maybe a bad idea)
        Parameters:
        location - The path to where the ilda file should be exported
        frames - All frames that should be included in the ilda file
        palette - An IldaPalette that will be appended in front of the ilda file with a format 2 header
        ildaVersion - ilda format: should be 0 or 1 since only those two formats use a palette for their colour information but nobody is stopping you from appending a palette to a format 4/5 file, though that would be pointless

      • fixHeaders

        public static void fixHeaders(java.util.ArrayList<IldaFrame> frames)
        Fixes the frame headers eg. updates point count, frame number, total frames, ... It leaves the frame name and company name untouched. It assumes the frames form a complete sequence.
        Parameters:
        frames - A reference to the frames whose headers need to get fixed.

      • fixHeaders

        public static void fixHeaders(java.util.ArrayList<IldaFrame> frames,
                              java.lang.String frameName,
                              java.lang.String companyName)
        Fixes the frame headers eg.updates point count, frame number, total frames It sets the frame name and company name to the arguments you gave it. It assumes the frames form a complete sequence (for the total frame entry). Call this before writing to an ilda file
        Parameters:
        frames - A reference to the frames whose headers need to get fixed.
        frameName - A name you want to give the frame
        companyName - Another name
